title: Jet2Holidays apologises over Turkish "terrorist" entertainment
text:
Jet2Holidays apologises over Turkish "terrorist" entertainment 13 August 2015 Save 
Jet2Holidays has issued an apology after a Turkish hotel’s entertainment left holidaymakers fearing they were being targeted in a terrorist attack. 
Customers staying at the five-star Grand Yazici Mares resort in Icmeler have told The Sun that they were relaxing by the pool last Thursday when a group of men wearing outfits and carrying pretend guns appeared. 
Holidaymaker Jason Phythian told the paper: “We were so relieved - it was the hotel’s idea of entertainment for the day. 
“They thought it was funny to run around the pool dressed as terrorists.” 
He added when they complained to the hotel, they were told to take it up with their Jet2Holidays rep instead. 
A spokeswoman for the tour operator apologised, adding: “The hotel management have assured us it was never their intention to cause any offence or upset with their entertainment programme. 
“This was a Hollywood-themed poolside show, which included the characters Rambo and Superman, and is always well received by the hotel’s residents. 
“The management now understands some of the costumes may have caused offence and will no longer use these in their shows.”
